prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.075, 0.0] Generate Sketch for Face 1 1. Create a new face (face 1) and draw a rectangle with the following line segments: * Line 1: [0.0, 0.405] to [0.15, 0.405] * Line 2: [0.15, 0.405] to [0.15, 0.0] * Line 3: [0.15, 0.0] to [0.6, 0.0] * Line 4: [0.6, 0.0] to [0.6, 0.405] * Line 5: [0.6, 0.405] to [0.75, 0.405] * Line 6: [0.75, 0.405] to [0.75, 0.48] * Line 7: [0.75, 0.48] to [0.0, 0.48] * Line 8: [0.0, 0.48] to [0.0, 0.405] 2. Close the loop and add a tangent arc (arc 1) connecting the endpoints of line segments 1 and 5, with a midpoint of [0.375, 0.405]. Generate Sketch for Face 2 1. Create a new face (face 2) concentric to face 1, and draw two circles with the following radii: * Circle 1: Radius 0.075 * Circle 2: Radius 0.045 Generate 3D Model through Extrusion 1. Scale the sketches by a factor of 0.75: `sketch_scale = 0.75` 2. Using the specified coordinate system, extrude the sketches along the normal for a depth of 0.075: `extrude_depth_towards_normal = 0.075` 3. The opposite direction depth should be 0: `extrude_depth_opposite_normal = 0.0` 4. Perform a "New Body Feature Operation" to combine the extruded sketches with the previous CAD models. CAD Part Description The part is a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The dimensions are as follows: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.075 * Height: 0.75</description>

<json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5122, 0.0] Create the 2D sketch for this part on the XY plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of a single face with the following loop: * Loop 1: + Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] + Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.5538] + Line 3: [0.75, 0.5538] to [0.0, 0.5538] + Line 4: [0.0, 0.5538] to [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop and apply any necessary constraints to ensure the loop is closed. Next, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a distance of 0.5122 to create the 3D model for this part. Note that this will create a new solid body. Part 2: Cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.1483, 0.0, 0.152] Create the 2D sketch for this part on the XY plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of a single face with the following loop: * Loop 1: + Arc 1: [0.0, 0.4018] to [0.1001, 0.0] to [0.2002, 0.4018] + Line 1: [0.2002, 0.4018] to [0.0, 0.4018] Close the loop and apply any necessary constraints to ensure the loop is closed. Next, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.4018. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the negative normal direction by a distance of 0.4181 to create the 3D model for this part. Note that this will cut or remove materials from the existing solid body. The final shape of the assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of approximately 0.5 units.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Hollow Center Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system based on the given Euler angles and translation vector. The Euler angles should be set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees, and the translation vector should be set to [0.0, 0.2381, 0.0]. This new coordinate system will define the orientation and position of the base sketch. Step 2: Draw the first face of the prism Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. Draw a series of curves and loops to form the first face of the prism. Curves: * Arc (clockwise): Start Point [0.0, 0.0404], Mid Point [0.0118, 0.0118], End Point [0.0404, 0.0] * Line: Start Point [0.0404, 0.0], End Point [0.7096, 0.0] * Arc (counter-clockwise): Start Point [0.7096, 0.0], Mid Point [0.7382, 0.0118], End Point [0.75, 0.0404] * Line: Start Point [0.75, 0.0404], End Point [0.75, 0.7096] * Arc (counter-clockwise): Start Point [0.75, 0.7096], Mid Point [0.7382, 0.7382], End Point [0.7096, 0.75] * Line: Start Point [0.7096, 0.75], End Point [0.0404, 0.75] * Arc (clockwise): Start Point [0.0404, 0.75], Mid Point [0.0118, 0.7382], End Point [0.0, 0.7096] * Line: Start Point [0.0, 0.7096], End Point [0.0, 0.0404] Loops: * Loop_1: Arc_1, Line_1, Arc_2, Line_2, Arc_3, Line_3, Arc_4, Line_4 * Loop_2: Line_1, Line_2, Line_3, Line_4 This face is a rounded rectangular shape with eight curves and two loops. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch_scale parameter. This scaling will result in a smaller prism. Step 4: Transform into 3D Sketch Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the given rotation and translation from the coordinate system. The extrude_depth_towards_normal property of 0.2381 will extend the shape in the direction perpendicular to the base sketch. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector with a depth of 0.2381 to generate the 3D model of the first part. This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a hollow center. Step 6: Determine the shape and dimensions The resulting shape of the first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a hollow center, and its dimensions are as follows: * length: 0.75 * width: 0.2381 (scaled) * height: 0.75 (scaled with hollow center) Use these instructions to guide the junior CAD designer in constructing the parametric CAD model for the first part. Provide the natural language instructions in the context of the finished shape, without making any additional assumptions.</description>
